section.title: Introduction
section.para: Each action that creates or edits data in mLaw is represented by an electronic document (edoc). Such an actions are creating or editing a conveyance, a court case, or a contract, assigning or editing a court case, conveyance or contract assignment, creating or editing a conveyance type etc.

An edoc has a preset workflow that is aligned to the approval levels in the organization. An edoc also posses a state - that changes when the user takes actions on it. Each document has the following information:

listitem.para: This is the person who has initiated the action.
Submit - forwards the information to the next person in the workflow or commits the changes if there is no further approval needed.
Cancel - Cancels the edo. Any changes made will be lost.

Save - Saves the edoc so that it can be worked on at a later date. Saved documents can be retrieved from the action list or edoc search. Notifications may also be generated for saved documents depending on the user's configuration.

Once an document is created it has the status 'initiated'. When it is saved, it has the status 'saved'. If an initiated edoc is closed before it is saved, any changes are lost and cannot be recovered. The initiator clicks the 'submit' button to forward it to the next stage of the workflow if it exists. An edoc that needs further approval will have a status of enroute and will appear on the action list of the person/people who need to attend to it. An edoc that has no further approval stage in the workflow will have a status of 'final' once it is submitted.
This is a unique number that is assigned to each document and is incremental
The time the document was initiated
This describes in summary, the circumstances sorrounding the action being taken e.g. 'New conveyance for client James', 'adding terms of service', 'Steve Vs John'
This a more detailed description of the circumstances e.g. 'as agreed in the board meeting on 07 Sept 2012 where it was suggested by Director Peter and seconded by Director Paul'
This section allows the attachment of relevant files e.g. copies of certificates, certificates of search, scanned identification documents etc.

It contains information as to the actions that have been taken on the document starting from the initiator to the present. It also links the actions of the users to the state of the document at specific times.

section.title: Edoc Search
section.para: This is accessible on the main menu by clicking the 'doc search' menu or using the direct links in the shortcuts page. Using doc search, it is possible to locate documents based on their type, the initiator and the date created.

section.title: Action List
section.para: The action list is where edocs pending action are displayed. This applies to documents that have been saved by the user. When a user has been specified as an approver in a workflow, the submitted documents also appear on the action list in addition to receiving an email notification. The action list shows the type of document, the status, the action requested, edoc number among other details.
